language.label: Interface language
language.description: Set the language for the interface display

theme.label: Colour mode
theme.description: Choose light or dark colour mode

rtl.label: RTL
rtl.description: When enabled, the interface will display text direction from right to left

extAction.label: Click extension icon action
extAction.description: Set the action when clicking the extension icon
extAction.SmallWindowAlert: If the side panel takes up too much space, it is recommended that you use a pop-up window

SidePanelPosition.label: Side panel position
SidePanelPosition.description: Set whether the side panel is displayed on the left or right.

searchBoxPosition.label: Search box position
searchBoxPosition.description: Set the position of the search box

toolbar.label: Show toolbar
toolbar.description: When enabled, the toolbar is displayed
toolbar.moreOptionsDescription: You can control which icons appear on the toolbar.

tabNav.label: Show Tab navigation bar
tabNav.description: When enabled, the Tab navigation bar is displayed
tabNav.pinToToolbarReminder: Please pin the extension to your toolbar before removing this navigation.

bottomNav.label: Show bottom navigation bar
bottomNav.description: When enabled, the bottom navigation bar is displayed
bottomNav.pinToToolbarReminder: Please pin the extension to your toolbar before removing this navigation.

buttonPosition.label: Button position
buttonPosition.description: Set the position of the buttons

alwaysShowCloseButton.label: Always show close button
alwaysShowCloseButton.description: When enabled, the close button will always show; when disabled, the close button will only show when the mouse is hovering over the tab

fullScreenHideSidePanel.label: Hide side panel in full screen
fullScreenHideSidePanel.description: When enabled, the side panel will automatically hide when the page is in full screen. Due to Browser's limitations, the side panel cannot be automatically reopened. You need to manually reopen the side panel!

coloredbackground.label: Coloured background
coloredbackground.description: When enabled, the side panel will display a coloured background

backgroundPicture.label: Background picture
backgroundPicture.description: Click [+] to add a custom picture, click [-] to delete a custom picture. You can find your favourite pictures on the following websites.

backgroundColor.label: Background Color
backgroundColor.description: Select a background color for your interface.

backgroundGradient.label: Background Gradient
backgroundGradient.description: When enabled, the current background color will be used for a gradient effect. You can also adjust the gradient angle using the slider.

backgroundImageBrightness.label: Brightness
backgroundImageBrightness.description: Set the brightness, recommended only for dark mode

fluentOverlayScrollbars.label: Fluent scrollbars
fluentOverlayScrollbars.description: Use Microsoft Fluent design style scrollbars and overlay them on the web content

showFullUrl.label: Show full URL
showFullUrl.description: When enabled, the full URL will be shown under the tab title

currentWindowOnly.label: Current window only
currentWindowOnly.description: Only show tabs of the current window. If disabled, tabs from all windows will be shown

pinedTabsAsIcons.label: Show pinned tabs as icons
pinedTabsAsIcons.description: When enabled, pinned tabs will be displayed as icons and not in the list

pinToQuickAccess.label: Show quick access
pinToQuickAccess.description: You can set a tab to show up in Quick access so it'll be easy to find. Just right-click (or long-press) it and select Pin to Quick access. Unpin it when you donâ€™t need it there anymore by right-clicking (or long-pressing) it and selecting Delete from Quick access.The difference from pinned tabs is that Quick Access saves the URL and opens a new tab every time it is clicked.

selectFromHistory.label: Select from history
selectFromHistory.description: If you need to select from the history, your authorization is required
selectFromHistory.selectItemsToAddToQuickAccess: Select items to add to quick access:
selectFromHistory.deniedMessage: You have denied the required permission, so the settings have not changed. If you change your mind, please click again and allow authorization

collapsedGroupShowTabIcons.label: Show website icons when collapsing groups
collapsedGroupShowTabIcons.description: When enabled, collapsed groups will show tab icons

hoverPreview.label: Hover preview
hoverPreview.description: When enabled, hovering over tabs will show tab previews

previewWithThumbnail.label: Show thumbnails in preview
previewWithThumbnail.description: When enabled, previews will show tab thumbnails
previewWithThumbnail.alert: Capture the visible area of the currently active tab in a specified window. To call this method, the extension must have <all_urls> permission or activeTab permission.
previewWithThumbnail.deniedMessage: You have denied the required permission, so the settings have not changed. If you change your mind, please click again and allow authorisation

previewDelay.label: Preview delay
previewDelay.description: Set the delay time for tab previews when hovering over tabs, etc. (seconds). If set to 0, there will be no delay

showTabIndex.label: Show tab index
showTabIndex.description: When enabled, the tab index will be displayed next to the title, making it easy to active tab using [Ctrl+number] on Windows or [cmd+number] on Mac. Example: 1. stackoverflow.com 2. youtube, so that it's easy to do Ctrl + 2 on Windows or cmd + 2 on Mac to go to youtube

tabHistoryEnable.label: Tab history
tabHistoryEnable.description: When enabled, the history of websites opened in the same tab will be displayed.

tabHistoryOnlyOnActive.label: Show tab history only on active tab
tabHistoryOnlyOnActive.description: When enabled, show tab history only on the active tab,else show tab history on all tabs.

tabHistoryExpand.label: Expand tab history by default
tabHistoryExpand.description: When enabled, tab history will be expanded by default.

tabHistoryShowExpandBtn.label: Show expand tab history button in list
tabHistoryShowExpandBtn.description: When enabled, a button will be displayed in the tab list that you can click to expand or collapse tab history. If disabled, you can only use the right-click menu to expand or collapse tab history

tabHistoryShowUrl.label: Show tab history URL
tabHistoryShowUrl.description: When enabled, the tab history URL will be displayed, otherwise only the title will be shown

tabHistoryShowIconWhenCollapsed.label: Show icon when tab history is collapsed
tabHistoryShowIconWhenCollapsed.description: When enabled, show tab history icon when the list is collapsed

tabHistorySortBy.label: Tab history sort order
tabHistorySortBy.description: Select the sort order for tab history

tabHistoryKeepCount.label: Number of tab history entries to show
tabHistoryKeepCount.description: Limit the maximum number of tab history entries to show. Entries exceeding the limit will be hidden

saveRecentlyTabs.label: Save recently closed tabs
saveRecentlyTabs.description: When enabled, save recently closed tabs

dataSource.label: Data source
dataSource.alert: To search history records, you need your authorisation to enable
dataSource.deniedMessage: You have denied the required permission, so the settings have not changed. If you change your mind, please click again and allow authorisation

showInSidePanel.label: Show in side panel
showInSidePanel.description: When enabled, show in side panel

showInTabSearchResults.label: Show history in tab search results
showInTabSearchResults.description: When enabled, recent history records will be displayed in tab search results

limitSearchResults.label: Limit number of history records in tab search results
limitSearchResults.description: Set the limit number of history records in tab search results. History records exceeding the limit will be filtered
limitSearchResults.alert: Too many records will affect page loading speed

saveRecentlyTabsLimit.label: Number of recently closed tabs to keep
saveRecentlyTabsLimit.description: Set the number of recently closed tabs to keep

keepDays.label: Number of days to keep recently closed tabs
keepDays.description: Set the number of days to keep recently closed tabs. Expired data will be deleted

openDuration.label: Open duration
openDuration.description: Only tabs open for longer than the set time will be saved

shortcuts.alert: This page is for display only. To modify shortcuts, please visit [Extensions]->[Manage Extensions]->[Keyboard Shortcuts]

tabSwitch.label: PIP on Tab Switch
tabSwitch.description: Auto-enter PIP when switching tabs with an unmuted video

scrollSwitch.label: Switch to picture-in-picture when scrolling
scrollSwitch.description: If the current page is playing a video and the video is not muted and the video is out of the visible range when scrolling, it will enter picture-in-picture.

userActivitionAlert.title: User activation required
userActivitionAlert.tips_1: User activation means the user is currently interacting with the page
userActivitionAlert.tips_2: More specifically, activation triggers input events such as:
userActivitionAlert.tips_3: Note: Using the mouse wheel scroll or swipe gesture will not trigger!
userActivitionAlert.tips_4: If you would like further details, please visit:

customGroupNames.label: Custom group names
customGroupNames.description: You can add some pre-defined groups here, so you can quickly select them when you need to add tabs to a group. We have already preset some group names, which you can modify or delete according to your needs.
customGroupNames.ConfirmDeleteMsg: Are you sure you want to delete this name?

customGroupRemember.label: Remember site grouping
customGroupRemember.description: When enabled, if a site is added to a custom group, it will automatically use this group the next time the site is opened

tabGroupCollapseBehavior.label: Tab group collapse behaviour
tabGroupCollapseBehavior.description: Modify the behaviour of the browser tab group collapse
tabGroupCollapseBehavior.option_collapse_others: Show current group and collapse others

useBookmarkFolderNameAsGroupName.label: Use bookmark folder name as group name
useBookmarkFolderNameAsGroupName.description: Automatically use the bookmark folder name as the group name if the opened URL is in the bookmarks

groupSelectBookmarkFolderLevel.label: Select Bookmark Folder Level
groupSelectBookmarkFolderLevel.description: Choose the level of the bookmark folder to use as the group name

autoCreateOrJoinSameDomainGroup.label: Auto create or join same domain group
autoCreateOrJoinSameDomainGroup.description: When enabled, newly opened tabs will automatically join the same domain group. If the domain group does not exist, a new domain group will be created

groupFilterOutPinnedTabs.label: Filter out pinned tabs in groups
groupFilterOutPinnedTabs.description: When enabled, pinned tabs will not be added to groups

enableProgressBar.label: Enable progress bar
enableProgressBar.description: When enabled, a reading progress bar will be displayed below the tab title bar

readingProgressBar.label: Reading progress bar
readingProgressBar.description: When enabled, a reading progress bar will be displayed below the tab title bar

scrollHeightRatio.label: Scroll height ratio
scrollHeightRatio.description: The ratio of visible window height to page height. A progress bar will be displayed when the ratio is exceeded

playingProgressBar.label: Playing progress bar
playingProgressBar.description: When enabled, a playing progress bar will be displayed below the tab title bar

enableFloatBall.label: Enable float ball
enableFloatBall.description: When the side panel is closed, a float ball will be displayed on the right side of the page, allowing quick opening of the side panel.

saveMemoryAction.label: How to save memory on tabs
saveMemoryAction.description: To save memory on tabs, you can choose to close tabs or discard tabs.
saveMemoryAction.discardTips: A discarded tab doesn't go anywhere. We kill it but it's still visible on the browser tab strip. If you navigate back to a tab that's been discarded, it'll reload when clicked. Form content, scroll position and so on are saved and restored the same way they would be during forward/backward tab navigation.

discardInactiveTabsMinutes.label: How long to discard inactive tabs
discardInactiveTabsMinutes.description: When there is no audio or video being played on the tab and automatic discarding is not prohibited, the tab will be discarded after the specified time.

closeInactiveTabsMinutes.label: How long to close inactive tabs
closeInactiveTabsMinutes.description: When there is no audio or video being played on the tab and automatic discarding is not prohibited, the tab will be closed after the specified time.

disableAnimations.label: Disable animations
disableAnimations.description: Disable the ripple effect and disable all transitions

addNewSite.label: Add new site
addNewSite.description: Enter a new website address, such as 'www.example.com', and click 'Add'.

browserSettings.label: Browser settings
browserSettings.description: You can modify site settings, such as deleting data or changing site permissions.

autoDiscardable.label: Auto discardable
autoDiscardable.description: When enabled, the tab will be allowed to be discarded by the browser, and if you turn on performance and set the time to discard inactive tabs, the tab will be discarded after the specified time. If disabled, the tab will not be discarded

readingProgressBar.label: Reading progress bar
readingProgressBar.description: When enabled, a reading progress bar will be displayed below the tab title bar.
readingProgressBar.globaldisabledTips: You must turn on the reading progress bar in the global settings to modify this setting.

playingProgressBar.label: Playing progress bar
playingProgressBar.description: When enabled, a playing progress bar will be displayed below the tab title bar.
playingProgressBar.globaldisabledTips: You must turn on the playing progress bar in the global settings to modify this setting.

tabSwitchPip.label: PIP on Tab Switch
tabSwitchPip.description: When enabled, auto-enter Picture-in-picture when switching tabs with an unmuted video.
tabSwitchPip.globaldisabledTips: You must turn on the Picture-in-picture in the global settings to modify this setting.

clearHistoyAfterCLose.label: Clear history after close
clearHistoyAfterCLose.description: When enabled, the history will be cleared after closing the tab.

SyncTabs.label: Sync tabs
SyncTabs.description: Choose how to sync tab data, excluding private data such as cookies and personal information.
SyncTabs.globaldisabledTips: You must turn on sync in Global Settings to modify this setting.

SyncPrivateData.label: Sync private data
SyncPrivateData.description: Choose how to synchronise private data, such as website cookies, web page localstorage data, SessionStorage data, etc. Data will be encrypted before synchronisation.
SyncPrivateData.globaldisabledTips: You must turn on sync in Global Settings to modify this setting.

linkSettings.label: Link Preferences
linkSettings.description: Set up how links should be managed on this site.
linkSettings.listTips: Drag and drop to reorder. Rules with higher priority are placed at the top. Once a rule is matched, the following rules will be ignored.
linkSettings.linkMatchContentTips: Supports regular expressions. For instance, use '*' to match any sequence of characters and '?' to match a single character.

backgroundColor.label: Background Color
backgroundColor.description: Select a background color for this site.

fontColor.label: Font color
fontColor.description: Set the font color for this site.

enableQuickAccess.label: Show Quick Access
enableQuickAccess.description: You can set a tab to appear in Quick Access for easy access. Just right-click (or long-press) it and select 'Pin to Quick Access'. To remove it, right-click (or long-press) it and select 'Delete from Quick Access'. Unlike pinned tabs, Quick Access saves the URL and opens a new tab each time it is clicked.

selectFromHistory.label: Select from History
selectFromHistory.description: Authorization is required to select from the history.
selectFromHistory.selectItemsToAddToQuickAccess: Select items to add to Quick Access:
selectFromHistory.deniedMessage: You have denied the required permission, so the settings have not changed. If you change your mind, please click again and allow authorization.

importAndExport.title: Import/Export

options.preferencesInfo: Includes default general settings, display and data preferences, and switching user interface themes.
options.quickAccessWarning: The icon of an unvisited website may display abnormally. Donâ€™t worry, it will display normally after you visit and restart the browser.
options.siteConfigInfo: such as auto discardable,picture-in-picture on Tab Switch, reading progress bar, playing progress bar, etc.

importAndExport.fileError: File parsing error, please upload the correct JSON configuration file

import.label: Import from file
import.formTips: Select the data you want to import

export.label: Export to file
export.formTips: Select the data you want to export

SyncConfigs.label: Sync configs
SyncConfigs.description: Choose how to synchronise this extension's configurations.

SyncTabs.label: Sync tabs
SyncTabs.description: Choose how to sync tab data, excluding private data such as cookies and personal information.

OpenOrCloseTabsSynchronously.label: Open or close tabs synchronously
OpenOrCloseTabsSynchronously.description: When enabled, opening or closing tabs in different browsers will be synchronised. This only applies when the 'stay synchronised' option is active
OpenOrCloseTabsSynchronously.OpenOrCloseTabsSynchronouslyWarning: If you log in to the same account in two browsers at the same time and turn this option on, opening or closing tabs in one browser will perform the same operation in the other browser. If the website prohibits repeated logins with the same account, exceptions may occur.

SyncPrivateData.label: Sync private data
SyncPrivateData.description: Choose how to synchronise private data, such as website cookies, web page localstorage data, SessionStorage data, etc. Data will be encrypted before synchronisation.

screenSizeTips.pageSidebarRelase: Great news! We've introduced a new 'Page Sidebar' feature that allows you to add a sidebar to web pages without using the browser's built-in sidebar. Once enabled, simply hover your mouse over the edge of the window to bring up the sidebar. [View Settings](/options.html#/tabSidebarOnPages)
screenSizeTips.screenSizeWarningMessage:
We've detected that your current screen resolution may affect your experience with the side panel. Due to browser limitations, the minimum width of the side panel is 360 pixels. At your current resolution, the side panel may occupy {{percent}}% of your screen.

To enhance your experience, consider adjusting your screen resolution. Here are guides to help you:

- For Windows users: [Change your screen resolution in Windows](https://support.microsoft.com/windows/5effefe3-2eac-e306-0b5d-2073b765876b)
- For Mac users: [Change your Mac displayâ€™s resolution](https://support.apple.com/guide/mac-help/mchl86d72b76)

Please adjust only if necessary for your comfort and usage.
screenSizeTips.scaleWarningMessage: Your current display scale is set to {{scale}}%. A higher scale makes interface elements larger but reduces available space. Lowering the scale will show more content but decrease element size. Please choose a setting that best suits your reading comfort and workflow needs.

tabSidebarOnPages.title: Page Sidebar
tabSidebarOnPages.description: The page sidebar feature allows you to add a sidebar to web pages without opening the browser's built-in sidebar. This is particularly useful for users with smaller screens who find the browser sidebar too wide or inflexible. While the page sidebar offers limited functionality due to certain restrictions, it provides a more compact alternative. When enabled, you can access the sidebar by hovering your mouse over the edge of the window.

sidebarEnabled.label: Enable Sidebar
sidebarEnabled.description: Toggle to activate or deactivate the page sidebar

sidebarPosition.label: Sidebar Position
sidebarPosition.description: Select where the sidebar appears on the page

contentScriptWarning.warningMessage: Content scripts are small programs that enhance web pages with additional features. However, due to security and privacy restrictions, these scripts cannot run on certain types of pages. As a result, the sidebar may not appear on the following:
contentScriptWarning.webStore: Browser extension stores (e.g., Chrome Web Store, Microsoft Edge Add-ons)
contentScriptWarning.internalPages: Browser internal pages (starting with chrome://, edge://, or about://)
contentScriptWarning.fileUrls: Local files on your computer (starting with file://)
contentScriptWarning.extensionsPages: Pages from other browser extensions (starting with chrome-extension:// or extension:// or similar)
contentScriptWarning.protectedPages: Websites with strict Content Security Policies
contentScriptWarning.newTabPage: New Tab pages (starting with chrome://newtab/ or edge://newtab/ or similar)
